description.narrative: Funding under this initiative supports the 2010/11 ANZSOG Short Course program. The goal of the program is to promote excellence in public administration, public sector governance and economic reform. The program will expose participants to a range of contempory leadership and management skills and knowledge, and introduce them to OECD experiences of economic reform. The specific objectives are: 1) to increase participants' competencies and capacities in key areas of public management; 2) to enhance participants' leadership skills in understanding of the role of leadership in government; 3) to equip participants with knowledge and skills for organisational change and policy reform; 4) to provide practical learning within a rigorous academic framework; and 5) to strengthen the Australia-China relationship by building institutional linkages. This funding is AusAids contribution to the program and is valued at $1.0 million expensed in the 2010-11 financial year.
